question: Who among the following held that, “ Political system thus becomes a set of interrelated variables conceived to be politically relevant and treated as if they could be separated from other variables conceived to be politically relevant not immediately relevant to politics”?
explanation: A political system directs attention to entire scope of political activities within a society, therefore, David M. Wood held that,  “ Political system thus becomes a set of interrelated variables conceived to be politically relevant and treated as if they could be separated from other variables conceived to be politically relevant not immediately relevant to politics.”
